publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: Queene Elizabeths looking-glasse of grace and glory : Wherein may be seen the fortune of the faithfull: that is to say, the wrastling, victory, and reward, or the combat, conquest and crowne of Gods children. All cleerely represented according to Scripture, & illustrated by diuers notable examples of Gods seruants both men and vvomen: and likewise enterlaced with many memorable alligories & morallties: both pleasant and profitable to be read. By I.M. Master of Arts
monogr.author: Maxwell, James

div.head: ERRATA.
Such escapes as haue beene committed in the presse, the gentle Reader shall find corrected heere in this Page.
div.p: PAg. 23. lin. 2 for they, read. 1) p. 34 lin. 4. for laborinth read lauer) p. 46. lin. 21. for assemble read resemble) p. 52. lin. 1. after) selfe, adde perfite) p. 59 lin. 9. for and, read end) p 69 lin. 21, for whom, read who) p. 84. lin. 1. for faith read truth) p. 108 lin. 18, for contentions were, read contentious men) p. 109. li 16. for nicenes, read nicetics) p. 173. lin. 1. for force, read face.
